document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

28FE3BD856674D6AB489B753B2195989.description: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation.

7924E8AA1B56436A8BE4DDD2426FD3B0.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas,
thoughts, and feelings.

276C0D95CBF44B20885A522E0DC1F9FF.description:
Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings
clearly.

0A1FEF7B0B064495A9308B2774ACA5B6.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information
or clarify something that is not understood.

095D8B1D74B6421F8C955B7794BB3932.description:
Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally
or through other media.

DC311F37ED3D42058CD70FAE40E95ACC.description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

5E2B33E5EDDA465CA851AC9E51876FFE.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through
multiple exchanges.

A933619E384D47F1AE2FE0F8D65E7092.description:
Follow agreed-upon norms for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one
at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

8E8339D978F34662B8E64EEC76B6EFEC.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts
with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

1A5E55854AEE401194B0A9E6C9CA4338.description: Engage in discussion, drawing, and writing in brief but regular writing tasks.

501750C5725B4ED4932ABACF12CE022E.description:
With guidance and support from adults, gather and select information from multiple sources
to answer a question or write about a topic.

2004F2001E0A4ABEB5C59A475CEF1BCF.description:
With prompting and support, generate questions through shared research about a topic and
determine possible sources to obtain information on that topic.

5D439D4024BC415A817B40F0147A81E7.description:
With prompts and support, find and correct errors of spelling, capitalization, and
punctuation after skills have been taught.

827F7F1B23314ABB80E3E173F846B21F.description: With prompts and support, identify audience and purpose before writing.

E3FFE3B1C378424A9DA25B5E5FAE5E76.description:
With prompts, guidance and support develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning,
revising, and editing.

C179DEC7E21A48DAB491294CFD1CCA7C.description: Provide a reaction to the experiences or events.

669343468D0F469C926F5B859F34B644.description: Use transitional words to manage the sequence of events.

C27279A566D347489B68A94A849850A8.description: Provide dialogue and/or description and details of experiences, events, or characters.

FA9E7166354D403DA9778514C1404ED5.description:
Using words and pictures, establish a situation and/or introduce characters; organize an
event sequence.

E16B79558EE140909697A9EE39941118.description:
With prompts and support, write narratives of several complete sentences based on real or
imagined experiences or events.

AA006C31BF9F41219108B131705E3952.description: Develop the topic with facts or other information and examples related to the topic.

0BEFDBF2371846DC9344F5E3DF332785.description:
With prompts and support, write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey
ideas and information.

DAB7B11F0BB445659F16FBD6D05D8882.description: Support the opinion with facts or other information and examples related to the topic.

84CED3D808874819A91E071F78DCDB3C.description: With prompts and support, write opinion pieces on a topic or texts.

6C2C5B9A5CA843598ECDB5675FB6DCE7.description:
Identify similarities in and differences between two informational texts on the same topic (e.g.,
characters, experiences, illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

379D8A8C7E094077BA882770D90B0E37.description:
Identify similarities in and differences between two literary texts on the same topic (e.g.,
characters, experiences, illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

F78D07782E704D1BBCEBCBA7EFE8EDCE.description:
Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text and explain how that
information is applied, with prompting as needed.

8430018A6A4B41E9BA37BA0D1016C42E.description:
With prompting and support, use text features (e.g., diagrams, tables, animations) to describe
key ideas.

DD0085B6C82848448183C90D1E51F893.description:
With prompting and support, use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters,
setting, or events.

C004D8E401094AE8BF7323EA5D5A66A0.description:
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information
provided by the words in a text.

351056FB2AB045A2B3B82EC79FD0A0D0.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

AC4295CE0AA1460EBEF423F6D1DB255D.description:
With prompting and support, explain major differences between books that tell stories and
books that give information, identifying various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents,
glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text while drawing on a wide
reading of a range of text types.

A3F1EE1D394F467AB4ADE168E2F1497C.description:
With prompting and support, explain major differences between books that tell stories and
books that give information recognizing organization and features of literary texts (e.g., follows a story
line, chronology of events, interprets illustrations) while drawing on a wide reading of a range of text
types.

F62D95C6D5D941F5B78ACD0A6A7DDD90.description:
Describe relationships among pieces of information (e.g., sequence of events, steps in a
process, cause-effect and compare-contrast relationships) within a text.

137CCB5958964AF7B5DFEB2352326ABB.description: Describe characters, settings, and major event(s) in a story, using key details.

C6542E97D4F349A58F2E2A9B83D661BC.description:
Determine main topic and retell a series of key details in informational texts (e.g., who, what,
where, when, why, how).

7DE1E3E7617E45E89C20C61A549BCA22.description:
Determine central message and retell a sequence of events in literary texts (e.g., who, what,
where, when, why, how).

626568A03984427D8ED98E3F0F242BFD.description:
Ask and answer questions about key details in an informational text (e.g., who, what, where,
when, why, how).

E4FF56E9A1B64B418F29F217138FC28C.description:
Ask and answer questions about key details in a literary text (e.g., who, what, where, when,
why, how).

89A75A5A0F4B498EB15B6C70FC5D5319.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance,
stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or
choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

E7FB897927E34504A6576AFC01FB1C9E.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that
are cozy).

03D15851564645A29198B70C30F82177.description:
Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that
swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

2697AE347DCF40B384065D58C49C6A82.description:
Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the
categories represent.

770F6565887A404D97CDE4477317AB99.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

31C080659DC341CAA65B2DF8AC2EE551.description:
With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of figurative language,
word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

6AFB8D742140428FB6A98843017F7B6D.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

11420E8C05054055B334A47C3ACA1F72.description: Choose flexibly from an array of strategies to determine the meaning of words and phrases.

CECE11DE43F046CBAF4DA20223E42D70.description:
Ask and answer questions to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content.

0E87931599A04276B8ECADA2ED3ED714.description:
With prompting and support, develop knowledge of language and its conventions when writing,
speaking, reading, or listening.

7476EFDEB1FB40238166AF9B70B1D4AE.description: Use conjunctions appropriately in sentences (e.g., and, but, so, and because).

9C74021845E4410686C6729C1BB6B774.description:
Elaborate a simple subject or simple predicate, in response to questions who, what, where,
when, how, or why.

2F32F192067E4596BAA5753C7D8FFBC3.description:
Write statements in response to questions, and questions transformed from statements,
using conventional word order.

6CD0F36D0B0642A9B95BA365EC8ECFB5.description:
Distinguish between a complete sentence and a sentence fragment and supply the missing
phrase or clause.

B9BE793CFAED4952BF056CE1A0C083DE.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

DC892F70DAAB4F8E83E9CA9F64758D2B.description:
Match periods, question marks, and exclamation points to statements, questions,
commands, and exclamations.

4ACD06B0B32545BFB0BE85C1CE45612D.description:
Capitalize the first word of a sentence, days of the week, months, names of people, and
proper names.

FE8EA385F19049DB9C41019966B3A86F.description: Supply the “who,” “is doing,” “what,” in a subject-verb-object sentence frame.

457D540FFC964DC38B3F856483027AAF.description:
Demonstrate command and use of the conventions of writing, (including those proficiencies
listed in L.WF.K.3):

8674C063FA414A76A12560802C2AD036.description: Initial and final consonant blends (must, slab, plump).

C0501118ED6445D7B9DAFD16FF49011F.description:
Consonant graphemes including qu, x, and –ck; digraphs (thin, shop, when, much, sing); and
doubled letters (off, will, mess).

01F1C2ACC0AD4621AC6F2DE7A790605C.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of encoding and spelling common, regular,
single-syllable words (including those proficiencies listed in L.WF.K.2) with:

7E3BEAE527664F6BABE23FF4F0CBE918.description: Recognize that each syllable is organized around a vowel sound.

4CB2AE2E220640EF92A6D346B638A8FB.description: Orally segment the phonemes in any single syllable, spoken word.

C4D71C1A89A94FE19FF36F4144FBB9BD.description: Write a common grapheme (letter or letter group) for each phoneme.

5B6CD919CD8142A586972E97E3ACB154.description: Write the upper and lowercase alphabets from memory.

6F04C093AD214325B0ECD8BA7BB7AE13.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of writing (including those proficiencies listed in
L.WF.K.1).

5069BEB798E546589630FB64DA4B8049.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

A01F4426D7AC45039C7F575F02EE065F.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

ED0D469A3D54401B9CB3510750F0B84F.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

3CD9592D432D4201AC9BC55952BA2A7B.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

706C7CA4503647DBBE6B0AD9A22BE1A5.description: Recognize the parts of high-frequency words that are regular and the parts that are irregular.

582EA629D1374381826A9E5B61C74E60.description: Read high-frequency and grade-level irregular words with automaticity (e.g. fly, walk, old).

C34C3CD0FA27438081172BEB27F137CF.description:
Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables
using knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound.

6D61A013D4F64C7C89E452C27C771ADD.description: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable words.

9391C985890044CCB0D27942D2473627.description: Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for representing long vowel sounds.

D4C9AA7FF5BF46159D5BBE0D458E7156.description:
Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common consonant digraphs (two letters that
represent one sound).

05CAE14544F8474B839F30905C0DCE36.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

A935E6D4C9CF4A8BB16E2643FF1789EA.description:
Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

AC1DFEB167BD4D5C8B90F1477636A14D.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken
single-syllable words.

0A5921E00010404AB4EA22F0773A121B.description:
Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant
blends.

6E59AB3ED1384CEEAA340648E61F5853.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

0DC77561CE6E4D7F93BEE0514A9B6467.description:
Demonstrate mastery of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes) by using knowledge
that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

C8FD10E6FCE24782B4F1156BCABFA6DB.description:
Demonstrate mastery of the organization and basic features of print (including those listed
under L.RF.K.1); recognize and understand the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word,
capitalization, ending punctuation).
